title: Science Education Based on Situated Learning Through Nursing Simulation Chemistry Experiments

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Realizing situational learning through chemistry lab simulations and nursing practice-linked activities in a smartphone-based microlearning environment.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze chemical reaction mechanisms of drugs through simulation experiments and apply them to nursing practice
Learners systematically record and manage chemical experiment data using electronic lab notebooks, enhancing clinical judgment skills
Learners can practically apply general, organic, and biochemistry (GOB) principles to nursing situations (e.g., fluid administration, drug interactions)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
